result.execSummary:
The defendant David S Cooper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft by Contractor <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 779.02(5).
  • Theft by Contractor <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 779.02(5).
  • Theft by Contractor <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 779.02(5).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Huber granted. Costs (from the original JOC) waived. 63 days credit by stipulation. Court makes finding this is the correct amount of credit.

Defendant had court-appointed counsel in this matter and will be ordered to repay Richland County for costs of that counsel once the final bill is known. Payment arrangements may be made with the Clerk of Court.

JOC AMENDED 12/9/18: Amount of Dean counsel fees now known in this case. Defendant to reimburse Richland County $1580.24 for Atty. Peter Lawrence's work in this case. Payment to be made directly to the Richland County Clerk of Court. A payment plan will be allowed but must be sought by the Defendant if such is needed.

15CF96 (sentencing after revocation case), 18CM14, 18CM29 all called together. Defendant David S Cooper in court, in custody, with attorney Peter K. Lawrence. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney John L. Conlon in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Def stands mute for entry of NG pleas in 18CM29. 

Court conducts sentencing after revocation hearing in 15CF96. Atty Conlon states the agency's recommendation was: Count 1-9mo in jail concurrent, Count 2&3-6mo in jail. Atty Conlon asks to follow the recommendation. Atty Harper, in Victim Witness Coordinator's place, reads victim impact statements. Atty Conlon addresses the court. SS gives his victim impact statement. Atty Lawrence addresses the court. CC addresses the court. Defendant addresses the court.

Court orders: 7.5 months in county jail, concurrent on every count. Huber granted. 63 days credit by stipulation. Waives costs. 

In 18CM29, parties stipulated to a $5,000 sig bond with bond conditions of def not to take any work in the heating/cooling field unless prior approval by court.  So ordered. Court sets 18CM14 and 18CM29 over to April 4th at 1:30pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 22, 2018 at 11:00 am.

18CM14/initial appearance and 15CF96/scheduling of sentencing after revocation. Defendant David S Cooper in court, in custody (on probation hold in 15CF96) with attorney Peter K. Lawrence. Attorney John L. Conlon in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.

Initial appearance completed in 18CM14. Formal reading waived. Def stood mute for entry of NG pleas. 

Status in 18CM14 and sentencing after revocation in 15CF96 set for 2/22 at 11. 

Atty. Conlon presents the Court with a stipulated subpoena for records.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for February 22, 2018 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling conference on January 24, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
SEHR to be rescheduled. 3:30 p.m. calendar time to be used for scheduling.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 24, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
Atty. Lawrence's request for reset of the Jan. 19th SEHR
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 19, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

3:20 p.m. Defendant David S Cooper in court, in custody. Prosecuting Atty John L. Conlon appeared for State of Wisconsin. Today was to be sentencing after revocation date. Def has presented Court with request for court appointment due to indigency. Court appoints Atty. Peter Lawrence and orders $50/mo, first payment due 2/1/18. Atty. Conlon notes new charges are coming; initial for that set for 1/19. Court orders Atty. Lawrence appointed for the new matter as well. This case and the pending case continued to 1/19 at 1:30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency
Waiver of Right to Attorney-Vacated by the Court on 01/10/18.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 12, 2018 at 02:45 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 12, 2018 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant David S Cooper in court, in custody, without counsel. Prosecuting Atty John Conlon appeared for State of Wisconsin as special prosecutor. Court notes def previously had Atty. Peter Lawrence. Def states Atty. L was privately-retained; says he can't afford counsel and has called SPD - doesn't qualify. Per Atty. Conlon, agent's recommendation is 9 months county jail. Court asks def if he wants time to consider counsel appointment. Def wants to waive his right to counsel. Court takes a recess to allow def time to complete waiver. Recess. Back on the record, Atty. Conlon informs the Court that additional charges may be filed as a result of the allegations in the revocation summary; believes def should have counsel. Court does not accept def's filled-out waiver but rather adjourns this hearing and provides def with court-appointment petition/directions.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for January 12, 2018 at 02:45 pm.
for Civil Judgment for Court Ordered Financial Obligations

Defendant David S Cooper in court with attorney Peter K. Lawrence. Prosecuting Atty John L. Conlon appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution calling for amendment of count 1 to misdemeanor; def to plead to counts 1, 2, and 3 (all misdemeanors) for probation disposition and dismissal/read-in of count 4.  Restitution has been paid and letters of apology written/submitted.  

Def pleads no contest.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Counsel and def address the Court.

Sentence:  Withheld for 2 years probation.  Condition of probation:  Do not operate businesses without consent of the agent.  Follow all rules of probation.  Pay costs.
Status conference at 03-24-2016 03:45 pm

Attorney Peter K. Lawrence in court for Defendant David S Cooper. Special prosecuting Atty John Conlon appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant David S Cooper not in court.  Atty. L asks Court to excuse def's absence; states reason.  No objection from prosecutor.  Conlon asks for adjournment; notes that def has succ. sold his business; that will allow him to take advantage of State's offer.  Court sets 3:45 on 3/24 for plea/sentencing.  Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Status conference at 03-02-2016 09:00 am

Defendant David S Cooper in court with attorney Peter K. Lawrence. Prosecuting Atty John L. Conlon appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel advise the Court that the parties are working towards resolution; asks for reset.  3/16 at 9 for status.  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.
DC
Adjourned initial appearance at 01-20-2016 09:00 am
All monies defendant receives from customers be used exclusively for the benefit of those customers, not for earlier or other obligations.

Defendant David S Cooper in court with attorney Peter K. Lawrence. Prosecuting Atty John L. Conlon appeared as special prosecutor for State of Wisconsin.  Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as his rights including right to prelim on count 1.  Jan. 20 at 9 for adjourned initial.  Prelim time limits have been waived with def reserving right to prelim.  Atty. Conlon asks for $500 signature bond with condition that all monies def receives from customers be used exclusively for the benefit of those customers, not for earlier or other obligations.  So ordered.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.
